com.cyc.kb

Interface Context

  • All Superinterfaces:
    KBIndividual, KBObject, KBTerm
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContextImpl

    public interface Context
extends KBIndividual
    The interface for KBIndividuals that correspond to CycL microtheories. Contexts are organized in a multiple-inheritance hierarchy. Facts and rules are asserted in a specific Context, and are true both in the Context in which they are asserted and in any Context that extends it.

    • Method Detail

      • getExtensions

        Collection<Context> getExtensions()
        Finds the contexts that are asserted to extend this context, in DefaultContext.forQuery(). Effectively, this returns the asserted bindings for ?CONTEXT from (#$genlMt ?CONTEXT this).
        Returns:
        the contexts that are extensions of this context (i.e. the specializations of this context)

      • addExtension

        Context addExtension(String moreSpecificStr)
                     throws KBTypeException,
                            CreateException
        Creates a new Fact stating that the #$Microtheory represented by moreSpecificStr is a specialization (an extension) of this context. Essentially, this asserts (#$genlMt moreSpecific this)

        The moreSpecific context has access to all knowledge (assertions) asserted in this context.

        The new fact is added in #$BaseKB.

        Parameters:
        moreSpecificStr - the string representing the new extension of this context
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

      • addExtension

        Context addExtension(Context moreSpecific)
                     throws KBTypeException,
                            CreateException
        Creates a new Fact stating that the #$Microtheory represented by moreSpecific is a specialization (i.e. an extension) of this context. Essentially, this asserts (#$genlMt moreSpecific this)

        The moreSpecific context has access to all knowledge (assertions) asserted in this context.

        The new fact is added in #$BaseKB

        Parameters:
        moreSpecific - the new extension of this context
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

      • getInheritsFrom

        Collection<Context> getInheritsFrom()
        Finds the contexts that this context is asserted to inherit from, in DefaultContext.forQuery(). Effectively, this returns all asserted values for ?CONTEXT from (#$genlMt this ?CONTEXT)
        Returns:
        the contexts that this context inherits from (i.e. those that are generalizations of this context)

      • addInheritsFrom

        Context addInheritsFrom(String moreGeneralStr)
                        throws KBTypeException,
                               CreateException
        Creates a new Fact stating that this context inherits from moreGeneral. Effectively, this asserts (#$genlMt this moreGeneral)

        The this context has access to all knowledge (assertions) asserted in moreGeneral context.

        The new fact is added in #$BaseKB

        Parameters:
        moreGeneralStr - the string representing the generalized (context) of this context
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KBTypeException

        CreateException
        KBTypeException

      • getMonad

        Context getMonad()
        Returns the monad of this context. A context monad specifies the "dimension" of the Context. The monad of the Context is the base context without additional context dimensional constraints. The TimeInterval is one of the main context constraints supported. See #$mtMonad for more details
        Returns:
        the monad of this context.
